thread.title: Friday’s roundup: Surprising Hough Huskies take 2nd big bite out of dream season
thread.title_full: Friday’s roundup: Surprising Hough Huskies take 2nd big bite out of dream season

author:
Langston Wertz Jr. 
lwertz@charlotteobserver.com
title: Friday’s roundup: Surprising Hough Huskies take 2nd big bite out of dream season
text:
October 16, 2015 Friday’s roundup: Surprising Hough Huskies take 2nd big bite out of dream season 
Huskies upset No. 3 AL Brown on road, take over solo first in MECKA 8 conference 
Mecklenburg County’s lack of “super” team may lead to wild playoffs 
Friday’s top performers and roundup Hough High quarterback Jackson Gibbs (11) runs with ball carrier Marquill Osborne (3) while facing Mallard Creek Oct. 9. Gibbs and Osborne helped the team beat AL Brown 21-7 to secure first place alone in the MECKA 8 conference. Photo by JASON E. MICZEK - Special to the Observer JASON E. MICZEK WWW.MICZEKPHOTO.COM South Meck Sabres wide receiver Chance Kennedy tries to fake out Charlotte Catholic defenders Greyson Krone, left, and Xander Gagnon, right, following a pass reception on Friday, October 16, 2015 at South Meck High in Charlotte, NC. Jeff Siner jsiner@charlotteobserver.com South Meck Sabres running back Zack Gilbert scores the first touchdown of the game vs Charlotte Catholic on Friday, October 16, 2015 at South Meck High in Charlotte, NC. Jeff Siner jsiner@charlotteobserver.com South Meck Sabres linebacker DeAngelo Blair-Young looks to disrupt a Charlotte Catholic pass attempt during second quarter action on Friday, October 16, 2015 at South Meck High in Charlotte, NC. Jeff Siner jsiner@charlotteobserver.com Charlotte Catholic Matt White fumbles a punt return as South Meck Sabres defensive back John Brannon makes the hit during first quarter action on Friday, October 16, 2015 at South Meck High in Charlotte, NC. Jeff Siner jsiner@charlotteobserver.com South Meck Sabres Moryah Johnson rushes for extra yardage following a pass reception vs Charlotte Catholic during second quarter action on Friday, October 16, 2015 at South Meck High in Charlotte, NC. Jeff Siner jsiner@charlotteobserver.com Charlotte Catholic Jaret Anderson is unable to stretch the ball across the goal line as South Meck Sabres Seth Mann makes the stop during first quarter action on Friday, October 16, 2015 at South Meck High in Charlotte, NC. Jeff Siner jsiner@charlotteobserver.com Charlotte Catholic Jaret Anderson fights to pick up yardage vs the South Meck Sabres during first quarter action on Friday, October 16, 2015 at South Meck High in Charlotte, NC. Jeff Siner jsiner@charlotteobserver.com Charlotte Catholic's Connor Miller, left, sacks South Meck Sabres quarterback AJ Elam during second quarter action on Friday, October 16, 2015 at South Meck High in Charlotte, NC. Jeff Siner jsiner@charlotteobserver.com South Meck Sabres quarterback AJ Elam passes to a receiver during second quarter action vs Charlotte Catholic on Friday, October 16, 2015 at South Meck High in Charlotte, NC. Jeff Siner jsiner@charlotteobserver.com Charlotte Catholic Dom Amico, right, breaks up a pass meant for South Meck Sabres wide receiver Moryah Johnson, left, during first quarter action on Friday, October 16, 2015 at South Meck High in Charlotte, NC. Jeff Siner jsiner@charlotteobserver.com Charlotte Catholic's Andrew Brouse, left, and South Meck Sabres wide receiver Chance Kennedy, right, fight for control of a pass during second quarter action on Friday, October 16, 2015 at South Meck High in Charlotte, NC. Kennedy was credited with the reception. Jeff Siner jsiner@charlotteobserver.com Charlotte Catholic's Jaret Anderson fights free of the South Meck Sabres defense on a touchdown run during fourth quarter action on Friday, October 16, 2015 at South Meck High in Charlotte, NC. Charlotte Catholic defeated South Meck 10-7. Jeff Siner jsiner@charlotteobserver.com Charlotte Catholic's Jaret Anderson fights free of a South Meck Sabres defender on a touchdown run during fourth quarter action on Friday, October 16, 2015 at South Meck High in Charlotte, NC. Charlotte Catholic defeated South Meck 10-7. Jeff Siner jsiner@charlotteobserver.com Charlotte Catholic's Jaret Anderson, left, is congratulated by teammate Connor Miller, right, following Anderson's touchdown run vs South Meck during fourth quarter action on Friday, October 16, 2015 at South Meck High in Charlotte, NC. Charlotte Catholic defeated South Meck 10-7. Jeff Siner jsiner@charlotteobserver.com Charlotte Catholic's John Newman, front, has a pass reception broken up by South Meck Sabres defensive back Jacobe Clement, top, during fourth quarter action on Friday, October 16, 2015 at South Meck High in Charlotte, NC. Charlotte Catholic defeated South Meck 10-7. Jeff Siner jsiner@charlotteobserver.com Charlotte Catholic's Connor Miller, right, sacks South Meck Sabres quarterback AJ Elam during fourth quarter action on Friday, October 16, 2015 at South Meck High in Charlotte, NC. Charlotte Catholic defeated South Meck 10-7. Jeff Siner jsiner@charlotteobserver.com Charlotte Catholic's Jaret Anderson, left, fights free of South Meck Sabres defensive back John Brannon, right, during fourth quarter action on Friday, October 16, 2015 at South Meck High in Charlotte, NC. Charlotte Catholic defeated South Meck 10-7. Jeff Siner jsiner@charlotteobserver.com Charlotte Catholic's John Newman, front, has a pass reception broken up by South Meck Sabres defensive back Jacobe Clement, top, during fourth quarter action on Friday, October 16, 2015 at South Meck High in Charlotte, NC. Charlotte Catholic defeated South Meck 10-7. Jeff Siner jsiner@charlotteobserver.com Charlotte Catholic's Xander Gagnon intercepts a pass by South Meck Sabres quarterback AJ Elam in the final seconds of fourth quarter action on Friday, October 16, 2015 at South Meck High in Charlotte, NC. Charlotte Catholic defeated South Meck 10-7. Jeff Siner jsiner@charlotteobserver.com Charlotte Catholic's Xander Gagnon jumps into the air following the team's victory over South Meck on Friday, October 16, 2015 at South Meck. Gagnon intercepted a pass by South Meck Sabres quarterback AJ Elam in the final seconds of fourth quarter action to seal Charlotte Catholic's 10-7 victory over South Meck. Jeff Siner jsiner@charlotteobserver.com Charlotte Catholic's Owen Hall, left, congratulates teammate Xander Gagnon, right, following the team's victory over South Meck on Friday, October 16, 2015 at South Meck. Gagnon intercepted a pass by South Meck Sabres quarterback AJ Elam in the final seconds of fourth quarter action to seal Charlotte Catholic's 10-7 victory over South Meck.
